channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX

item.title: Report X-2024070764
item.description:
Report X-2024070764

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found wet near a load door. Shipping label was only half legible. Tracking number or barcode were not visible. Tracking number was found matching the package to SPIDR images. Box, shipper, recipient and weight were matched to package with images. 2 bottles of chlorinating liquid were inside the box. 1 was crushed and half empty. Both were soiled. No hazard diamonds or markings were seen on outer box.

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: FORT WORTH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: Package was found in damage area contained in thick Hazmat bags. During examination, moisture could be seen around the valve on the top of the metal drum when the drum was turned sideways but seemed to disappear shortly after.

item.title: Report X-2024070575
item.description:
Report X-2024070575

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found on a cart next to the conveyor belt coming from unload. Box was ripped wide open and had wet spots. Upon inspection, all 4 of the 5 liter plastic bottles were full and no active leakage was found. However, 2 of the bottles were lightly soiled and had small drops of moisture on the outside, which tested as a pH 10-12, the same as the liquid inside. This suggests that prior leakage, although minor, occured.

item.title: Report X-2024070554
item.description:
Report X-2024070554

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-06
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Appears too much weight was placed on the package which caused the (4) 1-Gal Plastic bottles to compress. This compression caused the liquid Xylene to be expressed out through the cap. QA was notified, package was removed inside of red plastic tote utilizing all appropriate PPE (i.e. gloves, mask and goggles) to Hazmat cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2024070372

X-2024070406 Package was found in QA damage area partly torn with minor wet spots. 1 of the 4 5 liter plastic bottles leaked from the cap when turned sideways. item.title: Report E-2024070086
item.description:
Report E-2024070086

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: PASADENA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 28 , 2024, at 1223 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Pasadena, Texas regarding the release of Biotrol 12.5. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors investigated and confirmed the release of 16 ounces of BIOTROL 12.5 (UN1791 Hypochlorite solutions, 8, III) from (1) 275-gallon IBC plastic tote. The release was caused by a loose lid and contained to the tote which contractors reported had completely dried. Contractors were able to successfully tighten the lid of the tote before departure. No waste was generated during this ER response.

item.title: Report I-2024070002
item.description:
Report I-2024070002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: Orange
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At approximately 18:25hrs 6/20/2024, Southeastern Freight Lines employee reversed a forklift out of trailer onto the loading dock and turned around when he pulled forward, he accidently punctured a 275-gallon tote IBC containing UN3264 product with the forks of the forklift this put a one-foot gash on the bottom comer of the tote. Causing approximately 200 gallons of product to be released on the loading dock, apron and parking lot. The forklift operator and out bound operations manager applied floor dry attempting to contain the product. The tote was maneuvered on its side in efforts to stop the spillage. None of the chemicals were near or entered any type of drain system. Southeastern Freight Lines Safety was notified approximately at 18:45hrs. Hazmat one was notified approximately at 18:54hrs. Hazmat contracted Oil Mop to the spillage Oil Mop arrived at the premises at approximately 20:36hrs. and advised most of the product has already dried up so they are going to start getting neutralizer down on it, put absorbent, and recoup it into poly drums. There is about 60-70g left in the old tote that they are going to transfer into a new tote and will dispose of the old one. 20:36hrs Hazmat one notified the Texas Spill Reporting Hotline at 800-832-8224 and spoke with Anthony he will notify region 10 the Report#20242263. 06/21/2024 15:20hrs Mop Oil called and said that they have finished cleaning the parking lot. They have moved inside and have sodium bicarb down on the floor. They will get all of this swept up and then must finish transferring the remaining product out of the tote. They are taking 4-drums with them for disposal and will have to return to get the tote of product later.

item.title: Report E-2024070072
item.description:
Report E-2024070072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: LUBBOCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, at 8AM, an OxyChem driver arrived at Air Liquide in Lubbock, TX, to deliver Hydrochloric Acid. The driver checked in with security, then positioned the tractor and trailer at the unloading sight and met with the customer representative to sign the BOL, as well as OxyChem's "In the Interest of Safety" form. At approximately 8:10 AM, the unloading hose was connected to the customers flange, the trailer internal product valve was opened, and the air inlet valve to the trailer was opened. As the driver was opening the external valve, Hydrochloric Acid began to leak around the threaded connection of a CPVC ball valve that is part of the trailer blow down piping system. The driver proceeded to the front of the trailer where he closed the air inlet valve, and then around the truck to the left front trailer fender where he activated the emergency shutoff valve. He then contacted the customer representative to make them aware of the leak. Approximately 10 gallons of product leaked into a containment area. No injuries, chemical exposure or environmental impact resulted from this leak.

item.title: Report E-2024070083
item.description:
Report E-2024070083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: ATASCOSA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AmeriGas Propane LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 3rd party carrier began loading storage tanks and the middle tank that was OOS was over-pressurized resulting in a vapor release. The liquid valve was turned off and locked, but the vapor valve was not, allowing vapor pressure to be put in the tank. The local FD was called and responded to the PRVs "popping" but they had already re-seated by the time they arrived. Approx. time of release was 5 min.
